boardgame.name: Cargo Noir
黑货船
boardgame.description: In Serge Laget's Cargo Noir _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; his fourth standalone box game from Days of Wonder _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; players represent _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;families_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; that traffic in smuggled goods in a 1950s noir setting. Each turn, you'll set sail to various ports where cargo is known to get _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;lost_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; for the right price _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; Hong Kong, Bombay, Rotterdam, New York and more _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; and you'll make an offer for the goods on display. If another family then offers more in that port, you'll need to up your bid or take your money and slink away to look for goods elsewhere. Stand alone in a port, though, and you'll be able to discretely move the goods from the dock to your personal warehouse. Says Laget in a press release accompanying the game announcement, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Everything in Cargo Noir grew from a core auction mechanism that is simple and trivial to explain _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; you can only bid up, and the last bidder standing gets the goods._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Once you collect goods, you can trade them in to add more ships to your fleet _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; allowing you to scout for wares in more locations _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; purchase Victory Spoils, or take other actions. The more goods you collect, the more valuable they can be. The player with the most Spoils at game end wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: KK Boardgames ~ supplier-direct games ~ your Canadian and US source for discount game prices based in Vancouver, BC and Blaine, WA. All prices in USD and all games are new and in shrink unless otherwise stated. For Canadian customers who want to pay in CAD, we can convert to CAD based on the current exchange rate. *** PRE-ORDER *** Cargo Noir - $40.73 (expected March 2011) *** PRE-ORDER *** SHIPPING: We are near the US/Canada border so we can ship from either country -- there are absolutely no customs fees for US and Canada orders! For Canadian orders, we ship with Canada Post and charge a flat rate for one game (based on your province, see below) + $1.50 for each additional game (up to a maximum of an additional $6). e.g. The 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th games ship for $1.50 each, all subsequent games ship for free. Metro Vancouver area $8.50 (1 business day) or $0.00* Victoria (South Vancouver Island) $10 (2 business days) BC $12 (2 business days) AB $13 (2 business days) SK $13 (3 business days) MB $14 (3 business days) ON $15 (4 business days) QC $15 (5 business days) PE,NB,NS $15 (7 business days) NL $17 (8 business days) YT $17 (5 business days) NU/NT/Remote areas $17 (up to 13 business days) *FREE local pick-up in Vancouver area. US Orders are shipped USPS from zipcode 98230. International Orders are shipped USPS Priority Mail International with insurance and return receipt. PROMOTIONS: Loyalty rewards: For every $50 of games on your order, receive a $2.50 credit to be used on a future order. PAYMENT METHODS: We accept the following forms of payment: 1. Interac e-Transfer* (Canadian banks) 2. Cash on delivery (local pick-up greater Vancouver area) 3. PayPal (Instant Transfer or debit/credit card funded) 4. Credit cards (processed by PayPal - your information is never shared with us) 5. Money Order - we will accept postal money orders, but will not ship games until money order is received and cashed. Our prices include a discount for paying cash or another no fee method (1-2 above). All payments processed by PayPal (3-4 above) will incur an extra charge of $0.30 + 2.9% to pass on the exact processing costs charged to us by PayPal. International payments through PayPal are $0.30 + 3.9%. We will provide detailed payment instructions for you once the order is placed. CONTACT US: Although we will make an effort to respond to all questions via geekmail as quickly as possible, your response time will be faster if you send questions via email to kkboardgames+bgg@gmail.com

Cargo Noir Frais de port compris pour la suisse Dans Cargo Noir, les joueurs incarnent des familles de contrebandiers se livrant a` toutes sortes de trafics plus ou moins recommandables. Le jeu se déroule dans une atmosphère typique et emprunt de mystère des films noirs des années 50. En fonction du nombre de joueurs, le jeu s_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;articule autour de plusieurs grands ports de contrebande parmi Hong Kong, Bombay, Rotterdam, Panama, Tanger, Rio, Le Cap, New York et Macao. Chaque port accueille différents types de marchandises de contrebande, et certains sont plus fournis que d_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;autres. Les joueurs envoient leurs cargos dans les ports qui les intéressent - mais attention, seul le plus offrant pourra en remporter les marchandises, au nez et a` la barbe de ses concurrents ! Celles-ci seront ensuite stockées dans les entrepôts du joueur, puis revendues par combinaisons pour acquérir des cartes Victoire.
